channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4202] Video of SWAT Raid on Missouri Family
item.description: This is the result of modern prohibition in America. The Drug War is, was, and always will be a total failure. What would you do if this happened to your family?

item.title: [+2720] Holy Shit! Chrome is Fast! [Trippy Video]
item.description: Potato gun, lightning, and sonic magic: Unconventional speed tests for the browser.

item.title: [+2601] Hello Kitty [Pic]
[+2149] If Super Mario Bros. Was Made in 2010
item.description: Using eight images, game designer Zack Hiwiller shows us what Super Mario Bros. might look like, if it was made with modern sensibilities.

item.title: [+2101] FUTURAMA Sets Official Premiere Date!
[+1817] Someone should tell this guy his plate's expired
[+1287] Students Wearing American Flag Shirts Sent Home
item.description: Was it Freedom of Expression or Disrespect of a Cultural Holiday? High school officials in Morgan Hill accuse five high school boys wearing American flag t-shirts of trying to cause trouble.

item.title: [+1097] You Can't Trust Science? What about Religion?
item.description: 'Science has an agenda! Science is unreliable!' If you've ever heard a religious person say these words, you'll love this video.

item.title: [+932] Whatever Happened to the Hole in the Ozone Layer?
item.description: The hole in the ozone layer was perhaps the worst example of mankind’s impact on the planet, but a world-wide campaign against ozone-depleting chemicals has helped repair most of the damage.

item.title: [+915] BREAKING: Climate scientists cleared of malpractice by panel
item.description: A panel of six scientists have investigated the University of East Anglia’s Climate Research Unit - the target of the so-called "climategate" - and cleared them of "any deliberate scientific malpractice". Moreover, they found that while the scientists could have been better organized, their overall methodology is sound.

item.title: [+896] New Facebook Features Secretly Add Apps to Your Profile
item.description: You may inadvertently add Facebook apps to your profile just by visiting certain sites.You don't have to have a Facebook window open, you don't need to signed in to these sites for the apps to appear, and there doesn't appear to be an option to opt-out anywhere in Facebook's byzantine privacy settings.

item.title: [+850] Weeds Are Now Resisting Monsanto Weed Killer
item.description: Yep, thanks to Monsanto Roundup, American agriculture is in quite a fix now. See, Monsanto sells genetically modified seed that's supposed to survive spraying with their weedkiller. Unfortunately, the weeds learned to resist it--and now their GMO seed is struggling against the pesticide-resistant weeds that evolved as a result of their own product.

item.title: [+804] City of Boulder bans travel to Arizona
item.description: The city suspended all official city-sponsored travel to Arizona Wednesday in response to the state's passage of a controversial immigration bill.

item.title: [+772] Scribd: "We're Ditching Flash, Betting The Company on HTML5"
item.description: Adobe's much-beleaguered Flash is about to take another hit and online documents are finally going to join the Web on a more equal footing. Today, most documents (PDFs, Word docs, Powerpoint slides) can mostly be viewed only as boxed off curiosities in a Flash player, not as full Web pages. Tomorrow, online document sharing site Scribd will start

item.title: [+725] Arrest Everybody in Arizona
item.description: If speeding, broken tail lights, cracked windshields, and unfastened seat belts do not provide sufficient opportunities for immigration checks, police can use local ordinances regulating things like noise, yard upkeep, and the number of people living in one residence.

item.title: [+672] Facebook Security Captcha Fail (pic)
[+660] New Chrome beta takes the speed crown
item.description: A new beta of Google's Chrome Web browser brings a significant improvement in JavaScript performance. We took a hands on look and benchmarked Chrome against its rivals.

item.title: [+659] Just a bunch of pie charts and Venn diagrams
[+656] Texas Cops Need Help Getting Rid Of 200,000 Pounds Of Weed
item.description: The Brooks County Sheriff's Department has a marijuana problem. They've got 200,000 pounds of pot, and they're complaining that it would be too expensive to destroy it. We know a few people who might be willing to take a load off their hands.

item.title: [+619] 7 Systemic Problems that are Killing America
item.description: These problems go beyond Liberal or Conservative, Republican or Democrat. They’re serious enough to contribute to internal collapse.
